vocabInfos.lsjDefs:
ἐνάλιος [ᾰ], α, ον,
and ος, ον [Refs 5th c.BC+]: Epic dialect and Lyric poetry also εἰνάλιος, α, ον ος, ον [Refs 5th c.BC+]:— in, on, of the sea, κῆτος, κορῶναι, [Refs 8th c.BC+]; εἰνάλιον πόνον ἐχοίσας βαθὺν σκευᾶς ἑτέρας while the rest of the tackle is at work fishing deep in the sea, [Refs 5th c.BC+]; ἐ. θεός, of Poseidon, [Refs 5th c.BC+]; ἐ. λεώς seamen, [Refs]; πόντου εἰναλία φύσις, i.e. the fish, [Refs]; of islands, ἐ. Εὐβοιὶς αἶα [Refs]; ἐ. Χθών, of Tyre, [Refs 5th c.BC+]—poetical word, used in later Prose, ἐ. νῆσοι [Refs 4th c.BC+]

relatedNos._zh_tw_Gloss: 在, 裡, 藉著, 靠 ...
relatedNos._zh_Gloss: 在, 里, 借着, 靠 ...

vocabInfos.mediumDef:
creatures pertaining to the seamarine
marine, living in the sea, creatures pertaining to the sea Jas. 3:7*
vocabInfos._es_Definition: ser del mar, animal marino, pez
vocabInfos._vi_Definition: trong biển; sinh vật dưới biển; loài dưới biển. ἐν (G1722) + ἅλς (G251)
